com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getSalesOrderDetailsWithLocalQty

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getSalesOrderDetailsWithLocalQty

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getSalesOrderDetailsWithLocalQty(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      This is a deprecated API.

    • Method Detail

      • getSalesOrderDetailsWithLocalQty

        org.w3c.dom.Document getSalesOrderDetailsWithLocalQty(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                      java.rmi.RemoteException
        This is a deprecated API. Use getCompleteOrderDetails API . The getSalesOrderDetailsWithLocalQty API is used to determine what part of an order can be modified in the Increase Line Quantity, Cancel Order, and Change Delivery Option tasks of the Store Order Management user interface.This API checks if the specific Modification Type passed in the input is allowed for the order lines on the order. Please note that this API only considers a Modification Level of ORDER_LINE for this check. If the given Modification Type is not allowed based on the status modification rule configuration, the API checks to see if any of the order line quantity is owned by the Local Ship Node passed as input. The quantity is considered to be owned by the Local Ship Node when the order status records for that order line have been assigned to the Ship Node. If the quantity is owned by the Local Ship Node, then the API will include this quantity in the quantity that is allowed for modification. This will allow the user interface to present the appropriate modifiable quantity in the tasks mentioned above.
        getSalesOrderDetailsWithLocalQty API is a call to getSalesOrderDetails with some enhancements to determine if modifications can be made to an orderline, and provide some local override support. So the input and output xmls from this API should be very similar to the original getSalesOrderDetails API call, with the small exception of the additional attributes LocalShipNode and StatusModificationType in the input and HasLocalShipment ModificationAllowed, ModificationQty, PreReleaseModificationQty, PostReleaseModificationQty, ModificationReleaseKey in the output.
        Depending on the Status Modification Type provided, the Modification attributes can mean different things or not be valid at all.
        This API is identical to getSalesOrderDetails API with addition of LocalShipNode attribute and a StatusModificationType attribute on the Order Element. If neither of these attributes is passed as part of the input, this API should be operated exactly the same as getSalesOrderDetails API, and the extra attributes are not returned in the output. Also, the API reads the COM rules, YCD_CANCEL_PICKUP_LINES and YCD_CANCEL_DEL_LINES to determine whether to allow modification of order lines post-release.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Additional Information


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the sales order detail address details as well as the modification details. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
